alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 8:26PM EST until February 18 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... Elkhorn Creek Near Peaks Mill affecting Franklin County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Elkhorn Creek Near Peaks Mill. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Stillhouse Hollow Road floods. At 11.0 feet, Schoolhouse Road floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM EST Friday the stage was 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 4.0 feet early Wednesday afternoon. - Action stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding is possible and rivers are forecast to exceed bankfull. If you are in the advisory area remain alert to possible flooding, or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio and your local media for the latest information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk. The next statement will be issued with an updated forecast or the when the creek falls below advisory level.
